snippet: The magnitude 8.3 quake and ensuing tsunami left at least 11 people dead, wrecked houses and business and cut electricity for about 100,000 families.
abstract: Earthquake and subsequent tsunami devastate Chile's north-central coast, killing 11; authorities are encouraged, however, by government's improved response system after mishandling of similar disaster in 2010 resulted in prosecutions and loss of trust.

byline.original: By PASCALE BONNEFOY and SIMON ROMERO
byline.contributor: Pascale Bonnefoy reported from Santiago, and Simon Romero from São Paulo, Brazil.

lead_paragraph: The magnitude 8.3 quake and ensuing tsunami left at least 11 people dead, wrecked houses and business and cut electricity for about 100,000 families.

headline.main: Chile Sees Extensive Damage After Earthquake and Tsunami
headline.print_headline: Quake and Tsunami Cause Extensive Damage Along Chile’s Coast
